meanings.definition: Concerned with one's own interests or well-being.
meanings.sent1: She always makes egoistic decisions that benefit only herself.
meanings.sent2: It is natural to have some egoistic thoughts about your future.
meanings.sent3: In the story, the egoistic squirrel refused to share its nuts with the other animals.
meanings.sent4: His egoistic behavior created a barrier between him and his friends.
meanings.sent5: The egoistic cat only cared about finding the most comfortable spot to sleep.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an exaggerated sense of self-importance.
meanings.sent1: The egoistic king believed everyone should bow down to him.
meanings.sent2: Her egoistic attitude made it difficult for others to approach her.
meanings.sent3: The egoistic peacock strutted around as if it owned the whole garden.
meanings.sent4: His egoistic speeches made people question his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The egoistic boss thought the company would crumble without him.

meanings.definition: Acting in a self-centered or selfish manner.
meanings.sent1: He showed his egoistic side when he refused to help his friend in need.
meanings.sent2: The egoistic child always demanded to be the center of attention.
meanings.sent3: The egoistic cat pushed the other cats away from the food bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her egoistic behavior caused her to lose many friends.
meanings.sent5: The egoistic driver cut off other cars just to get ahead in traffic.
